page.title: 01Landscape: General View
page.content: This is Matthew Arnold country. It stretches from a loop of "the stripling Thames" to "the warm, green-muffled Cumner hillls". The area os within the Oxford Green Belt, and though only 4 or 5 miles from the centre of the City, retains much of its rural character. Development, or change of use, is controlled by the planning authority.The land-use of the block includes 4 residential areas: parts ofCumnor village and Farmoor, most of Dean Court and Cumnor Hill. The remainder is mainly devoted to mixed farming, including a fruit farm which offers pickk-your-own facilities in summer. The NW corner of the block is almost entirely occupied by the two adjoining Farmoor reservoirs. The area is bisected by part of Cumnor Hill bypass.
